Package com.intellij.psi.search

Class GlobalSearchScope

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.psi.search.SearchScope
      • com.intellij.psi.search.GlobalSearchScope
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VirtualFileFilter, ProjectAwareFileFilter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdditionalIndexedRootsScope, CompilerReferenceServiceBase.ScopeWithoutReferencesOnCompilation, CoreProjectScopeBuilder.ContentSearchScope, DelegatingGlobalSearchScope, EverythingGlobalScope, GlobalSearchScope.FilesScope, GlobalSearchScopesCore.DirectoryScope, JavaFilesSearchScope, LibraryRuntimeClasspathScope, LibraryScopeBase, MockGlobalSearchScope, ModulesScope, ModuleWithDependenciesScope, ModuleWithDependentsScope, NonClasspathDirectoriesScope, PackageScope, ProjectAndLibrariesScope, ProjectScopeImpl, ScratchesSearchScope

    public abstract class GlobalSearchScope
extends SearchScope
implements ProjectAwareFileFilter
    Project model-aware search scope.
    See Also:
    GlobalSearchScopes

      • compare

        public int compare(VirtualFile file1,
                   VirtualFile file2)
        Returns:
        • a positive integer (e.g. +1), if file1 is located in the classpath before file2
        • a negative integer (e.e -1), if file1 is located in the classpath after file2
        • zero - otherwise or when the files are not comparable

      • getUnloadedModulesBelongingToScope

        public java.util.Collection<UnloadedModuleDescription> getUnloadedModulesBelongingToScope()
        Returns descriptions of unloaded modules content of whose might be included into this scope if they had been loaded. Actually search in unloaded modules isn't performed, so this method is used to determine whether a warning about possible missing results should be shown.

        public static GlobalSearchScope filesScope(Project project,
                                           java.util.Collection<? extends VirtualFile> files)
        Please consider using this#filesWithLibrariesScope or this#filesWithoutLibrariesScope for optimization

      • filesWithoutLibrariesScope

        public static GlobalSearchScope filesWithoutLibrariesScope(Project project,
                                                           java.util.Collection<? extends VirtualFile> files)
        Optimization. By default FilesScope makes a decision about searching in libraries by checking that at least one file is placed out of module roots. So if you're sure about files placement you can explicitly say FilesScope whether it should include libraries or not in order to avoid checking each file. Also, if you have a lot of files it might be faster to always search in libraries.

      • filesWithLibrariesScope

        public static GlobalSearchScope filesWithLibrariesScope(Project project,
                                                        java.util.Collection<? extends VirtualFile> files)

      • filesScope

        public static GlobalSearchScope filesScope(Project project,
                                           java.util.Collection<? extends VirtualFile> files,
                                           java.lang.String displayName)
